hypothesis_content.title: Low-Float Meme Coin Liquidity Trap
hypothesis_content.statement: When a low-float, high-attention meme coin (e.g., PEPE, TRUMP) experiences a volume spike >500% of its 7-day average and a price gain >50% in a single day during ANY regime, a short entry at the next session's open will be profitable within 48 hours as liquidity evaporates.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme, unsustainable volume spikes in low-float meme coins are often driven by coordinated pumps or social media hype that lacks persistent liquidity. The subsequent fade is rapid as early buyers take profits and liquidity dries up, a pattern exacerbated after October's 'liquidity crash'.
entry_conditions: Asset = PEPE or TRUMP or similar meme/low-float
Enter short at next daily open after spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the spike day's range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds spike day's high by 5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If more than 40% of such spikes lead to continued trending (higher highs in next 48h), the hypothesis is falsified (indicating sustained viral adoption or new baseline liquidity).
